hanzi-su-wiki:
峠

Значения

Перевал

Мнемоника

Иероглиф японского происхождения. Участок горы 山, где заканчивается подъем 上 и начинается спуск 下.

qiǎ
mountain pass (Japanese kokuji)
горный перевал (яп. кокудзи)

(Japanese kokuji) mountain pass; (fig.) crisis point; pr. tōge

rtega_mnemonic:
峠峠RS𠧗mountain pass, crisis, climax
  • that which is up 上 and down 下: 𠧗 the mountain 山
heisig_keyword: mountain pass | горный переход, горный перевал
Keyword_KANJIDIC: mountain peak, mountain pass, climax, crest, (kokuji)
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: горный пик, горный перевал, климакс, гребень (kokuji)
koohiiStory1: Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he´d chosen mountain pass for this keyword as it´s closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a mountain pass is just below the mountain top.
koohiiStory2: To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note : the kanji does in fact refer to a "mountain pass".
jp_example_words: 峠(とうげ): ridge, (mountain) pass, difficult part
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you look at what's above and below a mountain you'll just see a bunch of ridges. Mountains are made of ridges going up and down, that's why they're so pointy and so hard to climb.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine looking off the edge of a mountain at all the big ridges going above and below it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: It's only on this type of mountain ridge that you'll be able to find the rare and adorable Tokyo gecko (とうげ). These tiny little critters can only be found on the ridges going above and below the mountains in Tokyo. There are like six mountains in Tokyo, so the next time you're scaling the ridges keep your eyes open for the Tokyo gecko!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture yourself sitting on a mountain ridge in Tokyo and watching a little Tokyo gecko run up and down on them. It's adorable and totally worth the climb.
Ru_Meaning: mountain peak, mountain pass, climax, crest, (kokuji)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: from above (上) and below (下) the mountain (山) you can see the ridge

Name meaning

qiǎ, kǎ
яп. горный перевал
Radicals: 山, 上, 下  (mountain, above, below)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you look at what's above and below a mountain you'll just see a bunch of ridges. Mountains are made of ridges going up and down, that's why they're so pointy and so hard to climb.
Imagine looking off the edge of a mountain at all the big ridges going above and below it.
Reading Mnemonic
It's only on this type of mountain ridge that you'll be able to find the rare and adorable Tokyo gecko (とうげ). These tiny little critters can only be found on the ridges going above and below the mountains in Tokyo. There are like six mountains in Tokyo, so the next time you're scaling the ridges keep your eyes open for the Tokyo gecko!
Picture yourself sitting on a mountain ridge in Tokyo and watching a little Tokyo gecko run up and down on them. It's adorable and totally worth the climb.
